1.text: My son, forget not my teaching; But let thy heart keep my commandments;

2.text: For length of days, and years of life, And peace, will they add to thee.

3.text: Let not kindness and truth forsake thee; Bind them about thy neck, write them upon the table of thy heart;

4.text: So shalt thou find grace and good favour In the sight of God and man.

5.text: Trust in the LORD with all thy heart, And lean not upon thine own understanding.

6.text: In all thy ways acknowledge Him, And He will direct thy paths.

7.text: Be not wise in thine own eyes; Fear the LORD, and depart from evil;

8.text: It shall be health to thy navel, And marrow to thy bones.

9.text: Honour the LORD with thy substance, And with the first-fruits of all thine increase;

10.text: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, And thy vats shall overflow with new wine.

11.text: My son, despise not the chastening of the LORD, Neither spurn thou His correction;

12.text: For whom the LORD loveth He correcteth, Even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.

13.text: Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, And the man that obtaineth understanding.

14.text: For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, And the gain thereof than fine gold.

15.text: She is more precious than rubies; And all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.

16.text: Length of days is in her right hand; In her left hand are riches and honour.

17.text: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, And all her paths are peace.

18.text: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her, And happy is every one that holdest her fast.

19.text: The LORD by wisdom founded the earth; By understanding He established the heavens.

20.text: By His knowledge the depths were broken up, And the skies drop down the dew.

21.text: My son, let not them depart from thine eyes; Keep sound wisdom and discretion;

22.text: So shall they be life unto thy soul, And grace to thy neck.

23.text: Then shalt thou walk in thy way securely, And thou shalt not dash thy foot.

24.text: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid; Yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.

25.text: Be not afraid of sudden terror, Neither of the destruction of the wicked, when it cometh;

26.text: For the LORD will be thy confidence, And will keep thy foot from being caught.

27.text: Withhold not good from him to whom it is due, When it is in the power of thy hand to do it.

28.text: Say not unto thy neighbour: ‘Go, and come again, And to-morrow I will give’; when thou hast it by thee.

29.text: Devise not evil against thy neighbour, Seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.

30.text: Strive not with a man without cause, If he have done thee no harm.

31.text: Envy thou not the man of violence, And choose none of his ways.

32.text: For the perverse is an abomination to the LORD; But His counsel is with the upright.

33.text: The curse of the LORD is in the house of the wicked; But He blesseth the habitation of the righteous.

34.text: If it concerneth the scorners, He scorneth them, But unto the humble He giveth grace.

35.text: The wise shall inherit honour; But as for the fools, they carry away shame.
